pages.text: If you don't want to hurt your hands, you should consider making some Makeshift Tools before you start gathering a ton of resources.

pages.title: Makeshift Knife
pages.text: A good weapon, and great for gathering plant fiber until you can make a real knife or scythe.

pages.title: Makeshift Axe
pages.text: Works well enough for most chopping needs. A suitable weapon, too.

pages.title: Makeshift Pickaxe
pages.text: Not the best for mining, but good enough to gather materials like Primsteel Ore.

pages.title: Makeshift Shovel
pages.text: Moves dirt more efficiently than your bare hands, but not by much.

pages.title: Makeshift Hoe
pages.text: Not great, but good enough to start farming quickly. Don't starve out there!

pages.title: Flint and Primsteel
pages.text: Not as good as using Iron, but hey, it works.

pages.title: Campfire
pages.text: With warmth on your side, you'll be alright.

pages.title: Torches
pages.text: Light seems to dissuade Monsters from appearing somehow.

pages.title: Stake
pages.text: Perfect for placing Torches on around your campsite to scare away monsters.

pages.title: Lantern
pages.text: A large variety of these exist, personally I prefer a Glow Squid Lantern any day. Not too bright, not too dark.

pages.title: Lantern Hanger
pages.text: Great for lighting up halls or marking doorways with Lanterns.

pages.title: Throwing Rock
pages.text: Not as good as an arrow; But hey, whatever downs the enemy.

pages.title: Wooden Staff
pages.text: I prefer Bamboo Staffs, they're much lighter- but these work well if heftier weapons aren't your style.

pages.title: Wooden Oar
pages.text: If you plan to travel the sea in a raft, you can't forget these!

pages.title: Makeshift Bone Knife
pages.text: A bit grisly, but it works just as well as any proper stone tool, in a pinch.

pages.title: Makeshift Bone Axe
pages.text: ...And since there's always so many undead skeletons about, resources to make them are plentiful.

pages.title: Makeshift Bone Pickaxe
pages.text: Still gives me the heebie jeebies to use them though.

pages.title: Makeshift Bone Shovel
pages.text: Just try not to think about where they came from too much.

pages.title: Makeshift Bone Hoe
pages.text: Then again, if you're using these- that's probably the least of your concerns.
